description: Concerning housing of inmates in state correctional facilities.

status.text: First reading, referred to Community Safety.

original.text:
H-0195.1
HOUSE BILL 1027
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Jacobsen, Marshall, Burnett, and Couture
Prefiled 12/10/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Community Safety.
AN ACT Relating to housing of inmates in state correctional facilities; and adding a new section to chapter 72.09 RCW.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 1. A new section is added to chapter 72.09 RCW to read as follows:
An inmate may not be housed in a correctional facility that primarily houses persons of a different biological sex than that of the inmate if the inmate has previously been convicted of a sex offense as defined in RCW 9.94A.030 against a victim whose biological sex is the same as those persons who are primarily housed in that correctional facility.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The main goal of House Bill 1027 is to regulate the housing of inmates in state correctional facilities based on their biological sex and previous convictions for sex offenses. The bill aims to ensure that inmates who have been convicted of sex offenses against victims of the same biological sex will not be placed in facilities primarily housing individuals of that sex, which is intended to enhance safety and security in correctional environments.

Key Provisions

Housing Restrictions

  • An inmate who has previously been convicted of a sex offense against a victim of the same biological sex cannot be housed in a correctional facility that primarily houses persons of that same biological sex.
